intro: Seseli calcareum, commonly known as limestone seseli, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Seseli calcareum is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
